intro: Stenogyne remyi, commonly known as the Hawaiian mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the genus Stenogyne, which is part of the Rubiaceae family, commonly known as the coffee family. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and mesic shrublands. Stenogyne remyi is a rare and endangered species, highlighting the importance of conservation efforts in Hawaii's unique ecosystems.
